Description: Axe-head: the cutting edge has been indented and chipped through use and is now corroded on both faces. The rest of the axe is also lightly corroded. The axe bears a number of surface imperfections, including a narrow gash, made by a sharp implement, near the edge on one face.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (16)
